description: Borrowed from French reconnaissance (“recognition”). Doublet of recognizance.

entries.meaning: The act of scouting or exploring (especially military or medical) to gain information.
examples: The third member, Sergeant Pieter Rousseau, had been with the back-up teams at the Hub; he was an expert on space reconnaissance instrumentation, but on this trip he would have to depend on his own eyes and a small portable telescope.
